item.title: What If You Couldn't Trust Your Fleet?
item.description: Behind every first responder is their trusty workhorse: the rugged Chevy Silverado Ambulance, the iconic Rev Group Ladder Tower, and the legendary Ford Crown Victoria and Explorer police interceptors. These vehicles – built in the United State by manufacturers like Ford, Chrysler, GMC, and Rev Group – are themselves every bit as American as the counties they serve. Emergency services in the United States have always bought and relied on American-made vehicles for two reasons: durability and reliability.
